This application is intended for a user study to examine the differences between touch-based input and facial-tracking.

The test will occur in a quiet room with favourable lighting conditions where the participants will be seated at a table. The Experiment mode will run a certain number of trials (default of 5) with one input method and then the same number of trials with the other method. In each trial, a random point on the map is selected (marked by the pin). The marker will always be placed in the field of view at the start of each trial.

In touch mode, the user must press the Start button to begin. To goal is to center the pin, while zooming until the indicated zoom difference is 0.0 (in the status bar). A crosshair will be provided to help the user center the marker. The user may pan the map by swiping left, right, up and down with one finger, and zoom in and out with two-finger pitch. Please do not use the double tap gesture to focus and zoom.

For the facial tracking mode, participants will be instructed to keep their hands and forearms on the table to ensure that the device does not move. The device will be tilted back slightly such that the participant\'s face is centered in the camera\'s field of view. User\'s face should be a distance of about 30 cm away from the screen to start. The user must remain still for 5 seconds before each trial begins. Moving one\'s head toward and away from the screen will zoom in and out respectively. Moving one\'s head side-to-side or tilting one\'s head left and right will pan the map west and east respectively. And Moving one\'s head up and down or tilting one\'s head up and down will pan the map north and south respectively. An indicator, will display the preceived location of the left and right eyes, the zoom difference as well as the direction to the target when outside of the field of view. Zoom difference of +/- 0.5 is acceptable. Centering is based on the focus between the eyes or the center of the screen.

A status bar at the bottom of the screen will indicate the difference in latitude, longitude and zoom from the desired target as well as the time elapsed. You will hear an audio tone to start and when you finish. Each trial is run for a maximum of 5 minutes, at which time the trial will time out. Press the "Finish" or "Timed Out" button to continue to the next trial.
